question: What is the maximum home loan I can get with an annual income of $80,000?
true_answer: Based on an annual income of $80,000, you can afford a home loan of approximately $240,000, assuming a DTI of 30% and standard debt obligations.

steps.content: What is the maximum home loan I can get with an annual income of $80,000?
Plan: 1) Hand off to home_loan_agent for loan calculation. 2) Use calculator for income to loan ratio. 3) Verify with supervisor_agent. 4) Return answer.

Standard practice allows a maximum DTI of 30% for loan calculation.
Calculating maximum loan based on $80,000 annual income.
Maximum loan calculated as $240,000 with a DTI of 30%.
Escrow costs typically not included in loan calculation, vary by region.
No additional credit checks required at this step.
Review complete, calculations and assumptions verified.
Can I get a breakdown of how the $240,000 was calculated?
The $240,000 is based on 30% of $80,000 annual income, accounting for typical debt obligations.
Based on an annual income of $80,000, you can afford a home loan of approximately $240,000, assuming a DTI of 30% and standard debt obligations.
